texts.es: El emprendedor José Aben, ya ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000 en el crédito anterior que solicito fue para abastecerse de producto para el negocio y poder brindarle a sus clientes un excelente servicio. Durante el crédito ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con un record crediticio intachable. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento pero en esta ocasión no es para el negocio, es para su vivienda le quiere realizar alguna remodelación, con el crédito comprara perlines, zinc, entre otros materiales de construcción.
texts.en: The entrepreneur José Aben has already worked with Fundación León 2000. With the previous loan he asked for he stocked up on products for his business to be able to offer his customers an excellent service. With the loan he has shown himself to be a responsible person with an impeccable credit history. Right now he is asking for a loan but this time it isn't for his business, but for his home. He wants to do some remodeling. With the loan, he will buy metal beams, zinc sheeting and other construction materials.

loans.use: to buy metal beams, zinc sheeting, and other construction materials.

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es: Nidia dice a sus financiadores de Kiva: “Muchas gracias porque con su apoyo, puedo seguir adelante:” porque ella recibió un credikiva con el cual compró artículos de la canasta familiar como ranchos, víveres, refrescos etc., con los que surtió su negocio y le fue bien, pues vendió todas las mercancías. En la actualidad  está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará nuevamente artículos de la canasta familiar, como arroz, aceite, granos, víveres y abarrotes. Su experiencia en el negocio y disciplina de trabajo hace que cada vez mas su negocio crezca y la inversión que esta le haga sea exitosa.
texts.en: Nidia says to her Kiva lenders "Thank you very much. Because of your support, I can go ahead" because she received a credikiva with which she bought staples such as snacks, soft drinks, groceries, etc, that she used to supply her business and she was successful, since she has sold all the goods. She is currently applying for another credikiva, which she will use again to buy staples such as rice, oil, grains, supplies and groceries. Her business experience and work ethic are making her business grow further and turning any investment she makes into a success.

loans.use: to buy staples such as rice, oil, grains, supplies and groceries.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is twenty-five years old and runs a pool business to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years and employs one person. He describes his business environment as good because he has many customers. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to buy another pool table in the future. He has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a new pool table.

loans.use: To buy a new pool table.

loans.name: Dolgorjav

texts.en:
Dolgorjav is a widowed woman who lives with her 3 kids in Darhan city, the second largest city in Mongolia. Her youngest kid studies at college. She has been running a beauty supply business since 2000. When her husband left, she stayed with her 3 kids to be responsible for the kids and the family. 

She was trained in a beauty course before, and she has been running a well-known and good business since that time. Now she plans to expand the business by getting a laser machine to erase face spots. She is doing this for the family's needs. 

Dolgorjav is a diligent woman who says, "I would like to increase business activity by getting the laser machine so that there will be more customers who won't need to go to the capital city for a cure." The total amount she is requesting is 850,000 MNT to purchase a laser machine.

loans.use: To purchase a laser machine.

loans.name: Kubatana Group

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Heather from Machipisa, one of the oldest suburbs in Harare. She is married with one child, who attends school.  Heather runs a retail business selling clothes. The business has been in operation for 10 years. She says the main challenge faced is the poor shelter at the marketplace. 

Heather has requested a loan of $500 to buy winter wear for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to pay her child's school fees. In the future Heather plans to operate a self-owned shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is married. He has three children aged between four and nine. They all go to school. He has been a rice farmer for seven years. He would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and hire additional labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more out, and put aside more savings so that he can aim for better sustainability.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilisers and hire additional labor.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is married. He has three children aged between two and seven. Two of them attend school. He has been a rice farmer for two years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seeds and hire additional labor so he can get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output and also refurbish his own house so he has a magnificent view.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilisers and seeds and hire additional labor.

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Damascene has nine children between one and twenty-five years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 1 year. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seeds and to support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output, and to renovate his house. In the picture, his fellow borrowers are behind him, witnessing.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds and to support labor costs.

loans.name: Ina

texts.en:
This is thirty-one-year-old Ina. She is married, and has two children aged ten and three. She has two additional dependents that live with her for schooling.  

In 2000, Ina established her drinks and provision business. She began in business following her husband's retirement six years ago because it was not easy to maintain their home. She worked assisting friends until she gathered enough capital to open her own business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,200,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of SLL 3,000,000 in order to buy 100 crates of soft drinks. She will use the balance to transport the drinks to the shop. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 963,000. In the future, Ina plans to become one of the strongest distributors of soft drinks by the grace of God and with the support of KIVA through ARD. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy 100 crates of soft drinks transport them to the shop.

loans.name: Cheziya Group

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Sarah from Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe. She is married with three children, and one attends school.  Sarah runs a retail business selling clothes. The business has been in operation for 5 years. She says the main challenge faced is high import duty fees. 

She has requested a loan of $500 to buy clothes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the welfare of the family. In the future, Sarah plans to open more clothes-selling stalls in the Central Business District of Harare .

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Tashinga Group

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Tambudzai from Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe. She is married with two children, one of whom is attending school. Tambudzai runs a retail business selling clothes. The business has been in operation for 5 years. She says the main challenge faced is the bad shelters at the market. 

Tambudzai has requested a loan of $500 to buy clothes to sell. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general welfare of the family. In the future, Tambudzai plans to have a chain of boutiques in town.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a father of two children. He is married to a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for three years. He would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers ad seeds and hire additional labour so he can get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output and renovate his house. In the picture, Felix's fellow agriculture borrowers are behind him.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilisers and seeds and hire additional labor.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean De Dieu has six children between 3 and 14 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 2 years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seeds, and to support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds, and to support labor costs.

loans.name: Otgonbaatar

texts.en:
Otgonbaatar is a 40-year-old man who lives with his wife and a daughter in Central province in Mongolia. His wife is a salesman at a gas station. The daughter studies at the local secondary school. He has been running a taxi service business since 2005. He is an experienced driver who knows the direction and the distances well on Mongolian roads. He has been improving the household little by little by having the business. 

Now he plans to expand the business by repairing the car's motor, which has been broken due to the bad roads in the countryside. Otgonbaatar is a bright man who says, "I would like to expand the business by replacing the car motor. I wish to improve my household and live happily with my family." The total amount he is requesting to replace the motor is 2,300,000 MNT.

loans.use: To replace his taxi's motor.

loans.name: Iamze

texts.en:
Iamze is sixty-five years old. She is a widow and lives in a small village of Khoni District. Iamze earns a living through her agricultural business. She has a milk cow and a calf. Iamze produces cheese and sells on average 20 kg of this product in the village. Also Iamze grows maize on the family-owned 1 hectare of land. She uses part of the maize for feeding the cows and the other part is sold locally to wholesalers. Iamze’s total average monthly income is 250 Laris, including her monthly pension. 

Iamze requested credit to fix the fence of her yard. The old one is destroyed and can’t protect her yard from neighbors' cows and other domestic animals entering. Part of the credit will also be used to purchase wood to heat the oven. As the spring is quite cold this year in West Georgia, Iamze consumed all her winter wood supplies and she has to buy wood which will be enough for one month.

loans.use: to pay for fixing the fence and purchase wood for heating the house.

loans.name: Rubik

texts.en:
Rubik has been engaged in animal breeding and land cultivation for twenty years. On his farm he rears cows, calves, sheep and chickens. Also he grows potatoes and wheat on his own plot of land. He sells the dairy products he produces, potatoes and wheat at food markets, and sells meat to butcher’s shops. Thanks to farming Rubik is able to support his family. 

Rubik is fifty-eight years old and he lives in Ddmashen village, Sevan area with his wife, son, daughter-in-low and newborn grandchild. Rubik’s wife helps him in the agricultural business. His son is serving in peacekeeping troops and his daughter-in-low stays at home and takes care of her child.   

Rubik is asking for a $1,550 loan which will allow him to buy fodder for his farm animals and also potato seedlings and fertilizer in advance of sowing.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his farm animals and also potato seedlings and fertilizer in advance of sowing.

loans.name: Sarantsetseg

texts.en:
Sarantsetseg is a 34-year-old woman who lives with her mother and three younger brothers in an outer ger district without basic infrastructure, near Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her brothers attend local universities and the high school. 

She has supported her family for the past six years by operating a beauty salon at the largest outdoor market, and she has 3 employees. Sarantsetseg usually offers tattoos, manicures and massages. She takes special care of her employees’ families; therefore, her workers like her and their work. 

Sarantsetseg’s aim is to take care to her brothers' studies by creating a comfortable environment for their studies. We live in a new technology era, so her brothers need advanced technology notebooks. Therefore she is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase a new laptop for her brothers, which is especially useful for their future professions.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her brothers.

loans.name: Papias

texts.en:
Papias has two children who are between 2 and 7. The oldest attends school. He is married to a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 2 years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seeds, and to support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output, and to renovate his house.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds, and to support labor costs.

loans.name: Appolinaire

texts.en:
Appolinaire has one child. He is married to a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 6 years. He would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds, and to support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output. Behind him in the picture, fellow agriculture borrowers are standing.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds, and to support labor costs.

loans.name: Ivane

texts.en:
Ivane is 24 years old. He lives in a village in the Tskaltubo district of West Georgia. He lives with his younger brother, who is 22 years old. The only source of income for them is agriculture. They have a greenhouse as well as a plot of land, and both of them are used for growing greens and cucumbers. They sell their harvested products to local greengrocery retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 450 Laris. 

Ivane and his brother plan to expand the family business. They requested credit for purchasing materials for the construction of a second greenhouse. They will use it for the same purpose – growing greens and cucumbers. They will get more harvest and sell it through the same trade channels. The income of the brothers will increase, and they will be able to purchase the additional household and consumer goods they need for improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for greenhouse construction.

loans.name: Luong

texts.en: Luong would like to take another loan to buy more beverages and foods to sell from her cafe. The last loan helped her to expand her business and enabled her to increase her income and she hopes that another loan will enable her to further expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more beverages and food to sell.

loans.name: Kulu

texts.en:
Kulu is 46 year old and lives in Paynesville. She is married and has four children between 14 and 30 years old. They are currently in school and live at home.

For the past three years she has been selling charcoal in the local market. She makes a lots of profit and has many customers. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal by bags for her business. 

Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal by bags for her business.

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
This is 24-year-old Sulaiman. He is single and has one child, age 3 years. 

In 2007, Sulaiman established his DVD, VCD  and television business. He began his business because he wants to enhance his independence and that is the sole source of livelihood. 

Working seven days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Sulaiman has already received and successfully repaid a loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy DVDs, a 14-inch television and memory sticks. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 250,000. 

In the future, Sulaiman plans to establish a modern electronics shop and to establish another branch. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more DVD and VCD plates for his business.

loans.name: Kebah

texts.en:
Kebah lives in Sinkor. She is 32 years old and she is single. She is a university student.

For the past ten years she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She started this business by helping others and later began to sell on her own. Some challenges she faces include the the rainy season.

Kebah says handling her own money makes her happy about her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She wants to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
After her previous loan, Huong's small street-side restaurant is running well and she now would like to request a loan to buy better quality food to make meals and noodles for selling. 

She hopes that the loan will increase her income and improve the well-being of her family.

loans.use: To buy better quality food to make meals and noodles for selling.

loans.name: Randa

texts.en:
Randa is a 46-year-old widow, and she is responsible for four children since her husband passed away. Randa is a hard worker, and she is the family's only breadwinner. She took on responsibility for the whole family and is proud of what she is doing. Twenty-one years ago she started a small business from her house, preparing souvenirs for weddings, births and many other special events. She also arranges special bouquets of artificial flowers.

Randa has been an Al Majmoua borrower for two cycles. Through her previous loan, Randa opened a grocery store for her son in order to help increase her family's income, and it had a very impressive result on both their social & financial situations. She is applying for a new loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy tools and other items necessary for her business in order to increase her merchandise with special souvenirs.

Randa's history is in good standing, and she is working hard to open a small school that is specialized in teaching how to make handmade souvenirs. This is her dream that she hopes to make come true.

loans.use: To buy tools and other items necessary for her business in order to increase her merchandise with special souvenirs.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Thanks to her previous loan, Phuong was able to increase her stock of poultry and support her family with the income that she earned. 

Phuong would like to further invest in her poultry business by taking another loan to buy more chickens and ducks for raising and selling. 

She hopes that with this loan, her income will continue to increase and she can continue to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens and ducks for raising and selling.

loans.name: The Unity Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Unity” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standards of living. 

The leader of this group is Issatu. Issatu is 34.She was born in Tankoro-Kono. She is married to a businessman and the couple has three children – one in primary school and two in secondary school. 

Issatu has been a businesswoman for seven years now. She sells cooked rice. She has requested this loan in order to buy a larger quantity of cooking ingredients – rice, palm-oil, salt, pepper, tomatoes, onions, etc. In this way, Issatu will be able to cook a large amount of rice to meet her customers’ growing demand. 

(Also included in the photo is Edmond A. Ndoinjeh in the white shirt, handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of cooking ingredients – rice, palm-oil, salt, pepper, tomatoes, onions, etc.

loans.name: Son

texts.en: Son's previous loan enabled him to increase his sales of seasonal fruit and vegetables. Now he would like to request another loan to again buy more kinds of fruits and vegetables at a lower price from wholesalers to help him to make a higher margin on his sales. He and his wife hope that the expansion of their business will enable them to earn more income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of fruits and vegetables from wholesalers.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Mariama.  She is married and has 1 child, age 10 yrs. She has 2 younger sisters who live with her to assist in running her business.  In 1998, Mariama established her textiles business. She began her business at an early age with her mother. It was the only activity the family depended on. There was nothing else that could bring income into the home because of the ideology that girl children are not meant for school, but only to be at their marital homes. She was convinced of the concept and decided to be in line with the family. 

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. She requires a loan in order to buy 10 rolls of cotton lace @ 300,000 each. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 963,000. 

In the future, Mariama plans to rent a big shop on the most busy street in town so that she can have more sales and realize more profit, and also support her husband in educating their child to university level. Hardworking and very grateful, she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy 10 rolls of cotton lace.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Mohamed, a married father of four children aged 19, 16, 13 and 9 years. His nephew, who is attending school, and his mother also live with him.

In 1993, Mohamed established his tailoring business as his livelihood, and works 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, earning about Le 900,000 every month. Now requesting a loan of Le 3,000,000. to buy tailoring materials, he hopes it will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000.

In the future, Mohamed plans to own both a modern tailoring center and a house. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials.

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Saidu, a married father of two children aged 2 years and 5 months old. Two additional relatives live with him.

In 2009, Saidu established his cosmetics business to earn a living. Working seven days a week and nine hours a day, he earns about Le 2,500,000 every month and is now requesting a loan of Le 5,000,000 to purchase more cosmetics. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000.

In the future, Saidu plans to build a house, buy a motor vehicle, and expand his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Mohamed. He is married and has two children, age 11 and 9 years. He has one additional dependent who lives with him because he is schooling.  

In 2004, Mohamed established his used shoes business. He began his business because he sees the business to be lucrative, and that is his only source of income. 

Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 930,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid a loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy used shoes. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 300,000. 

In the future, Mohamed plans to establish a salon for his wife, to build a house and to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy used shoes.

loans.name: Tharcisse

texts.en:
Tharcisse has six children between the ages of 5 and 13. He is married to a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 35 years. He would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds, and to support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output. 

In the picture, there are other agriculture borrowers behind him, waiting to get their pictures taken by the lending staff.

 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds, and to support labor costs.

loans.name: Alamakan

texts.en: Bai Tushum and Partners expresses gratitude to all Kiva lenders who helped Alamakan obtain her first Kiva loan, which was used as intended and repaid. She was able to increase sales and obtain new customers.  Now Alamakan has applied for a loan of 25,000 KGS to broaden her assortment of goods.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable oil, sugar, and salt.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 47, has operated a business offerIng tailoring services and soft drinks since 2008. She began her business to earn the necessary income to help her husband in supporting the family. She and her husband have three children, aged 22, 18, and 14 years. Elizabeth's income has helped very much to assist in the improvement of the family's financial situation.

Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, Elizabeth earns about Le 930,000 every month from her business. 

She would like to request a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Elizabeth has already received and successfully repaid one loan. Her new loan funds  will be used to buy checkered and poplin cloth for her tailoring work, siphon material, and soft drinks to offer for sale. She is confident that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. 

In the future, Elizabeth plans to complete the construction of her house and to ensure the adequate education of her children.   

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy checkered and poplin cloth for her tailoring work, siphon material, and soft drinks to offer for sale

loans.name: Fata

texts.en: Fata lives in Sinkor. She is 38 years old, married with three children between 12 and 16 years old and her husband is a businessman. For the past three years, she has been selling rice, charcoal, peppers, Vita, oil, and other items in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and learned this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, Vita, charcoal, peppers, oil, and many other items for her business. Her plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, Vita, charcoal, peppers, oil, and many other items for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm oil, Maggi, salt, peppers, kola nuts, ginger, etc. in larger quantity to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Akob

texts.en:
Akob is a 61-year-old married man, father of one child. Akob has been working as a tailor since 1985. He works from his own house because his business doesn't bring in enough income to rent an atelier to work in.

Akob is a hard worker. He has a very good reputation and special customers who are very loyal to him since they like the good quality products he makes.

Akob has been an Al Majmoua borrower for twelve cycles. His previous loan was also a Kiva loan and it reflected positively on his income and his social standing.

This time his loan will also be invested in his business, since he used his saved money for his mother's funeral expenses. He will purchase a special tailoring machine necessary for his business. He hopes to stay in good health to keep his family living a happy life.

loans.use: To purchase a special tailoring machine

loans.name: Mama

texts.en: Mama is 40 years old. She lives in Sinkor along with her husband and children. She has five children aged 19 to 32 years. For 19 years now she has been selling rice, palm oil, charcoal, and  soap in her community. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother. She enjoys her business because it is a great help her to pay her children school fees and feed them. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, palm oil, charcoal, and soap for her business. She plans to sell a lot and improve her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, charcoal, and soap for her business

loans.name: Slko-000408-001 Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “God Help” group from Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. They are local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 500,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, increase their sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Dora, age 49, is the leader of this group. Her husband is employed as a civil servant and they have four children. Dora has been a businesswoman for 20 years now, selling dried fish.  With her share of this loan, she will buy baskets full of dried fish to add to her current stock and to offer for sale.

(Also included in the photo is Edmond A. Ndoinjeh in the white shirt, shown handing over the loan funds to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy baskets full of dried fish to add to her current stock and to offer for sale

loans.name: Abadahemuka /pr Group

texts.fr:
Azera fait partie du groupe Abadahemuka/Pr. Elle a 46 ans, elle est marie avec 7 enfants de 8 ans à 25 ans, dont 7 scolarises. Elle a 2 personnes dans son charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Azera est agriculteur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des engrais chimique et les semences  sélectionnent. Dans les prochaines années, Azera voudrait avoir un grand nombre des tonnes en dépôt de riz. Avec les profits, Elle prévoit de scolariser et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en: Azera is part of the Abadahemuka/pr group. She is 46, married with 7 children aged from 8 to 25 years old - 7 of whom are in school. She has 2 dependents apart from her children. She has completed 6 years of primary education. Azera is a rice farmer. This is her first loan with ACB. She will use his loan to purchase chemical fertilisers. Her strategy for growing his business is to use chemical fertilisers and selected seeds. In the coming years, Azera would like to have a large quantity of rice in warehouse. With the profits, she intends to put her children in school and to take care of them.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertiliser

loans.name: Imbarutso Group

texts.fr:
Chadrack fait partie du groupe Imbarutso. Il a 29 ans, il est marie, il n’a pas un enfant. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Chadrack est agriculteur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des engrais chimique sélectionne. Dans les prochaines années, Chadrack voudrait être un grand agriculteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de faire des épargnes pour bien eduquer ses futurs enfants.
texts.en: Chadrack is a member of the Imbarutso group. He is 29, married, and has no children. He has completed 6 years of primary education. Chadrack is a rice farmer. This is his first loan with ACB. He intends to use the loan to purchase chemical fertiliser. His strategy for growing his business is to use selected chemical fertilisers. In the coming years, Chadrack would like to become a major rice farmer in his area. With his profits, he intends to save so that he can provide a good education for his children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertiliser.

loans.name: Katakaran Group

texts.en:
Bintu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Bintu was born in a village called Bumpeh about 29 years ago. She is married to a businessman and the couple has two children attending primary school. For five years now, Bintu has been selling market-food – palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), onions, Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc. This is the first loan that Bintu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. 

With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Bintu will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business, she will buy palm oil, onions, Maggi, salt, pepper, etc. in large quantity to add to her current stock. 

(Also included in the photo is Edmond A. Ndoinjeh in the white shirt, handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, Maggi, salt, pepper, etc. in large quantity to add to her current stock

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Сафарали более десяти лет занимается скотоводством. Ему 33 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Сафарали имеет среднее - специальное образование. Он берет кредит для закупа бычка.
texts.en: Safarali has been breeding cattle for over ten years. He is 33 years old, married, and has four children. Safarali has specialized secondary education. He is taking out a loan to purchase a young bull.

loans.use: to buy a young bull

loans.name: Twitezimbere /rhh Group

texts.fr:
Francine fait partie du groupe Twitezimbere. Elle a 36 ans, elle est mariée avec 6 enfants de 6 à 17 ans, dont 6 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Francine est commerçante et aussi elle cultive des tomates pour les vendre dans sa boutique. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’accueillir des clients en les donnants services de qualité. Dans les prochaines années, Francine voudrait être grossiste. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de scolariser, soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Francine is a member of the group Twitezimbere. She is 36 years old, and married with six children aged 6 to 17, all in school. She completed six years of primary school. 

Francine is a merchant and she also grows tomatoes to sell in her store. This is her first loan cycle with ACB, and she will use her loan to buy chemical fertilizers and pay labor costs.

Her business growth strategy is to greet her clients and offer quality services. In the coming years, Francine would like to become a wholesaler. She will use the profits to provide for her children’s education and healthcare.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena tiene 33 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos de 16, 15 y 10 años de edad y estudian, vive en Cofradía, Cortes.
Maria tiene un negocio de pulpería el cual estableció hace 3 años. Vende productos de la canasta básica, como frijoles, arroz, manteca, harina, azúcar, huevos, pan y productos de abarrotería. Considera que este negocio es rentable porque los ingresos son a diario los cuales le ayudan a solventar algunos gastos de su familia. Dedicándose a trabajar en el todo el día.
Lleva 3 préstamos con ODEF los cuales manifiesta le ha ayudado mucho al sostenimiento del negocio, ahora solicita  su cuarto préstamo  de 5,300 lempiras para surtir la pulpería de productos alimenticios para seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes variedad de producto.Para así obtener buenas ganancias del mismo.
texts.en:
Maria Elena, age 33, is married and has three children, ages 16, 15, and 10.  The children go to school.  She lives in Cofradía, Cortes.

Maria has had her grocery store business for three years.  She sells basic needs food items like beans, rice, lard, flour, sugar, bread, and other grocery products.  She considers her business to be profitable because her daily income helps her to pay for some of the family’s expenses.  She devotes herself to working all day.

She has had three loans with ODEF, and she says that they have helped her a lot in sustaining her business.  She is now requesting her fourth loan for 5,300 lempiras to stock her grocery store with food products.  She will do this in order to continue offering her customers a variety of products.  This way she will get good earnings from her business.

loans.use: to buy food products to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Sharifamoh

texts.ru: Шарифамох проживает в районе Вахш. Ей 41 год. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Шарифамох занимается животноводством. В этой области она 12 лет. Кредит берет для закупа овец.
texts.en: Sharifamoh lives in the Vakhsh Region. She is a married 41-year-old woman with three children. Sharifamoh is engaged in animal husbandry. She has been in this business for 12 years. Sharifamoh is taking out a loan to buy sheep.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa  is 42 years old. She lives in Sinkor with her four children aged 21 to 27. For 10 years now, she has been selling rice, oil, slippers, and  soap in the local market. She started this business by selling bread for her friend and learned this way of selling from her friends. She enjoys her business because it is a help to improve her living conditions. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, slippers, and soap for her business. She plans to build a house and help her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, slippers, and soap for her business

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en:
Tamaz is 63 years old. He is from Khoni District, West Georgia. Tamaz lives with his family: his wife – Nazi and 31-years-old son. Tamaz works as driver in a local company. Nazi is retired and gets a monthly pension. Their son helps his parents in running the family business. Along with his main job, he is actively involved in the family agricultural business. They have a small dairy farm with two milk cows. Nazi produces cheese and sells on average 40 kg of this product onthe local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 550 Laris, including Nazi’s pension. 

Tamaz requested a loan for purchasing a milk cow. The family will then have more milk for cheese production. They will produce and sell 50% more cheese and the family’s monthly income will increase by 150 Lari. It will allow the family to spend more on satisfying their daily needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Faith In Action Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Faith In Action” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profits and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Betty. Betty is a native of Kono. She is married to a businessman, and the couple has three children. Her children are attending primary and secondary schools. Betty sells market food – rice, margi (used to give sauce enhanced taste), salt, pepper, etc. She has been in this business for six years now. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her business. 

(Also included in the photo is Edmond A. Ndoinjeh, in the white shirt, handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy rice, margi, salt, pepper, etc. in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Domicienne

texts.fr:
Domicienne est né au Rwanda. Elle a 49 ans, elle est mariée avec 9 enfants de 4 à 30 ans, dont 4 scolarises. Elle a 3 personnes dans son charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Domicienne est commerçante des poissons. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’agrandir son commerce des poissons.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est faire beaucoup des épargnes pour augmenter ses activités commerciales dans la future. Dans les prochaines années, Domicienne voudrait être une grande commerçante dans sa région. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de scolariser, soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Domicienne was born in Rwanda. She is 49 years old and married, with nine children between the ages of four and thirty years, four of whom are in school. She has three people in her care aside from her children. Her educational level is six years of primary school.

Domicienne is a fish seller. This is her third loan cycle with ACB. She is going to use her loan to expand her fish selling business.

Her strategy for the growth of her business is to save a lot in order to increase her commercial activities in the future. In the coming years, Domicienne would like to be a large retailer in her area. With the profits, she foresees educating and caring for her children.

loans.use: to expand her fish selling business.

loans.name: Fachima Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Fachima” group from Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. They are local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Aiah is the leader of this group. The 30-year-old is married to a teacher and they have two children. A native of Tankoro/Kono,  Aiah has been a businessman for 10 years now, he sells ready-to-wear clothes.  With his share of this loan, he will buy dozens of garments to add to his business inventory. 

(Also included in the photo is Edmond A. Ndoinjeh in the white shirt, handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy dozens of garments to add to his business inventory

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman. She has four children between the ages of 4 and 20; all are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Mohamed and he works as a administrator. 

Amina operates a food stall business. She sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for six years. Her primary customers are community members. 

Amina's other source of income includes a weaving business. She describes her greatest business challenge as the high cost of purchasing goods. Her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

Amina will use the KES 15,000 loan to purchase sacks of rice and beans, and bundles of wheat flour. Amina aspires to establish a café business in the future. She joined Yehu to access funds.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice and beans, and bundles of wheat flour.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is 25 years old, single, and has two children.  She lives in Sinkor and sells cosmetics, which she has been doing for four years. Helena started this business with help from a friend. 

Helena is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more cosmetics for her business.  She enjoys her business because she makes a large profit, which she will use to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Jazmin

texts.es: Jazmín compró implementos para peluquería e insumos como champoo, esmaltes, enjuagues etc. Ella está adecuando muy bien su negocio y cada vez es mejor; por eso hoy se prepara, para recibir un nuevo financiamiento mediante el fondo Kiva, con el que comprará una silla de peluquería e insumos en un mayor volumen, con el fin de brindar un ambiente mas confortable a sus clientes y de conseguir mejores precios en las compras de sus productos y mantener un stock de champoo, enjuague, masaje por galones. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Muchas Gracias por todo, debido al préstamo se me han abierto las posibilidades. Ahora tengo el negocio mas organizado,  un local donde presto los servicios de mejor calidad y mas comodidad.”
texts.en:
Jazmín bought hairdressing implements and supplies like shampoo, nail polish, and rinses, etc.  She is outfitting her business very well, and it keeps getting better.  Therefore, she is now ready to receive a new Kiva loan.  She will use the loan to buy a hairdresser’s chair and supplies in greater volume.

She will do this in order to provide her customers with a more comfortable atmosphere, to get better prices on the products she purchases, and to maintain a stock of shampoo, rinse, and massage products by the gallon.

Her message to the Kiva lenders is the following:  “Thank you very much for everything.  Due to the loan many possibilities have opened up for me.  I now have the business more organized and a place where I can provide better quality and more comfortable services.”

loans.use: to buy products and to keep gallons of shampoo, rinse, and massage products in stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy head bands, hair bid, lip stick, fingernails, make-up sets, and lip shiner and the balance will be used for transport

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Abdulai.  He is married and has no children. He only has one dependent who lives with him to assist him with sales.  In 2009, Abdulai established his lubricant business. He began his business because immediately after completing his sixth form, he had no sponsor to help him continue his education, so he decided assist friends in doing business with the aim of raising funds to continue his education. Unfortunately, his dream did not work out. 

After he raised some amount, he wanted to go to college but friends convinced him to establish his own business. He supported their idea and finally decided to remain in business and since that time, his business has grown fast.   Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000.

 Abdulai has already received and successfully repaid his first loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy 40 gasket makers @ 960,000, 50 break pads @ 20,000 and 30 sets of foot rests @ 70,000. The balance will be used for transportation. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 1,486,000. In the future, Abdulai plans to expand his shop and open another shop for his wife. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy 40 gasket makers @ 960,000, 50 break pads @ 20,000 and 30 sets of foot rests @ 70,000; the balance will be used for transportation.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen is requesting a new loan in order to pay for an order of new products to restock her general store. This purchase will help her better meet the demands from her customers. 

Yen's previous loan enabled her to improve the condition of her business and allowed her to offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales as well as help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of stock for her general store.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung's previous loan enabled her store to provide more of the spare parts required by her customers and increase the number of customers that she serves. 

Dung would now like to request another loan to buy a greater quantity of spare parts to sell from her store. She hopes that this will permit her to attract more customers and generate a higher income. She hopes that through the loan she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu lives in Sinkor. She is 34 years old and married with three children between the ages of 10 and 15. All her children live at home and attend school.

For a year now, Musu has been running a table market where she sells bitter balls, peppers, oil, okra and other items. She learned this business from her mother who makes lots of profit and has more customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bitter balls, peppers, oil, okra and other items for her business.

Musu plans to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bitter balls, peppers, oil, okra and other items for her business.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh's previous loan enabled her to increase the sales from her cafe and earn a higher income to support her family. 

Oanh would now like to request another loan to buy a greater quantity of higher-quality beverages and coffees to sell from her cafe. She hopes that this will permit her to increase her sales and income. She also hopes that through the loan she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy beverages and coffee for her cafe.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La socia Julia; continua con su trabajo y ella ahora desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio de comidas, la socia ha invertido en la compra de vajillas anteriormente y ahora desea poder comprar insumos al por maoyr y menor como arroz, fideos, aceite, combustible entre otros. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de aroz, fideos, aceite.
texts.en:
Julia continues with her work.  She now wishes to continue investing in her food business.  She has previously invested in the purchase of crockery.  She now wishes to be able to buy wholesale and retail supplies like rice, noodles, oil, and fuel, among other things.

She is requesting the loan to buy rice, noodles, and oil.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, and oil.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou habite  dans l’un des quartiers  d’une localité sénégalaise. Il est employé dans une société  de gardiennage. En meme temps il pratique l’activité de maçon et l’élevage de volaille. Il a choisi ses activités pour arrondir les fins de mois et diversifier ses sources de revenus. Il est membre d’un guichet de  l’U-IMCEC depuis mars 2007. Il sollicite un crédit de 85 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de sujets, en vue de répondre a la demande en poulets pendant les fêtes de pâques.
texts.en:
Mamadou lives in a neighborhood in a Senegalese village.

He is employed in a security company. At the same time, he is a mason and raises poultry in order to supplement his income and diversify his sources of income. He has been a member of a branch of the U-IMCEC since March 2007.

He is seeking a loan of 85,000 frs to buy chickens in order to respond to the demand for chicken during the Easter holiday.

loans.use: to buy chickens intended for resale during holiday periods

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie lives in Sinkor. She is 32 years old, single and has 3 children between the ages of  2 and 15 years old that live at home; the two older ones are in school. 

For 12 years now, Mamie has been selling oranges and bananas. She started this business from her savings. She makes lots of profit and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oranges and bananas for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more oranges and bananas for her business

loans.name: Ya-Almamy

texts.en:
This is 60-year-old Ya-Almamy. She is married and has 3 children, ages 38, 34 and 23 years. She has no additional dependents that live with her.  

In 1992, Ya-Almamy established her provisions business. She began her business because she did not go to school. Therefore, at the age of 20, her parents gave her for marriage to a business tycoon. As a hardworking woman, she decided to request from her husband to establish her own business and not to depend on the husband alone. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,050,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Ya-Almamy requests a loan in order to buy 60 tins of blue plate mayonnaise @ 15,000, 100 tins of luncheon meat @ 9,000, and 4 bags of sugar @ 280,000. The balance will be used to transport the goods to her shop. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 963,000 SLL. 

In the future, Ya-Almamy plans to expand the business and also hopes to see her children educated to a higher level. Hardworking and very grateful, she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy blue plate mayonnaise, luncheon meat, and sugar; the balance will be used to transport the goods to her shop

loans.name: Binh

texts.en: Binh's previous loan enabled her to increase the sales from her stall and earn a higher income to support her family. Binh would now like to request another loan to buy a greater quantity of higher quality food at more competitive prices to sell from her stall. She hopes that this will permit her to generate a higher margin on her sales and increase her income. She hopes that through the loan she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of higher quality food to sell from her stall

loans.name: Asatullo

texts.ru: Асатулло женат и на воспитании двоих детей. Он очень трудолюбивый и добрый человек. Более 3-х лет он занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур. Имеет участок земли и там сеет пшеницу, кукурузу и ячмень. Жена помогает по бизнесу. Он также занимается купле- продажей мелкого рогатого скота. Асатулло хотел бы получить займ для покупки семян пшеницы, ячменя и кукуруза для посева, а также покупки горюче-смазочных материалов. С прибылью он хочет улучшить свое домохозяйство.
texts.en: Asatullo is married and is raising two children. He is a very hardworking and kind man. He has been cultivating crops for more than three years. He has a plot of land where he sows wheat, cord and barley. His wife helps him in this business. Asatullo wants to get a loan to buy seeds of wheat, barley and corn for sowing and also to buy fuel and lubricants. He wants to use the profit to improve the living conditions at home.

loans.use: to seeds and fuel

loans.name: Jesudogbe Group

texts.fr: JESUDOGBE est un groupe de trois personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante du groupe du nom de Atènoumè (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 27 ans. Atènoumè est mariée à un éleveur du nom de Bathélémy. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Atènoumè vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Atènoumè n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Atènoumè vend depuis trois ans, des produits divers et de la farine de manioc dans son quartier. Atènoumè s’approvisionne dans une ville du Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue élargir son activité, Atènoumè sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUDOGBE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
JESUDOGBE is a group made up of three friends. The group representative, Atènoumè (who is raising her hand in the photo), is 27 years old. Atènoumè is married to a stockbreeder named Barthélémy. The couple has two children, all of whom attend school and are in their care. Atènoumè lives with her husband and children. The couple covers the various household expenses together. Atènoumè did not go to school.

To be able to cover her various expenses, Atènoumè has been selling various products and manioc flour in her neighborhood for the past three years. Atènoumè stocks up in a city in Benin.

Striving to satisfy her curstomers and grow her business, Atènoumè is seeking a second loan through ALIDé, along with the other members of the JESUDOGBE group. This loan will allow them to better meet the demand of their customers and increase their profit.

loans.use: to buy bags of manioc flour and various products

loans.name: Sadotkhuzha

texts.ru: Садотхужа трудолюбивый и активный молодой муж. Его жена домохозяйка и занимается домашними делами.  Более 3-х лет Садотхужа занимается предоставлением услуг такси. Он занимается этим бизнесом на арендованной машине, теперь хочет купить себе машину марки «Тикко» для того чтобы продолжить свой бизнес с целью получения хорошую прибыль. С этой целью запрашивает займ в размере 2100$ США. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Sadotkhuzha is a hardworking and active young man. His wife is a housekeeper. Sadotkhuzha has been providing taxi services for over 3 years. He uses a leased car to operate the business, but now wants to get a new Tico car in order to develop his business and get more profit.  Sadotkhuzha needs a loan of $2100 to purchase a new car for his business.  He is grateful for you help and kindness.

loans.use: To buy a car for his business

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.ru: Илхомчон честный и добрый человек. Он женат и  на воспитании имеет троих детей. Жена швея, а он занимается предоставлением услуг такси. Имеет небольшой опыт в данном бизнесе и старается обслуживать своих клиентов хорошо, чтобы они были довольными. Илхомчон запрашивает займ в размере 5000 Сомони для ремонта своего автомобиля. Он надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Ilhomjon is an honest and kind person. He is married and is raising three children. His wife is a seamstress, and Ilhomjon works as a taxi driver. He has a bit of experience in this type of business and tries to provide good services so that his clients are satisfied with his work. Ilhomjon is asking for a loan in the amount of 5,000 Somoni to get his car repaired. He hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: To get his car repaired

loans.name: Racha

texts.en:
Racha, age 21, is a hairdresser. She has been engaged in her business for the past four years in the house where she lives. She is unmarried. She receives a lot of support from her friends, neighbors, and relatives. They encourage her to prove herself in the hairdressing domain, which she loves being involved in.

Racha is a hard-working woman with a very good reputation. She initially started this business to supplement her parents' income. At present, her business is improving, but she finds that it needs to be updated with the special tools and machines necessary to provide for customers' needs and client demand.

Racha has applied for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary hairdressing tools and machines for her work. She also intends to use some of the funds to prepare a room in her house that will be customized for the business. A private salon area will provide a greater level of privacy and relaxation for her customers.

Racha is confident that in the future she will be able to invest in opening her own ladies' beauty salon that will provide many services.

loans.use: to buy the necessary tools and machines that will allow the professional improvement and expansion of her hairdressing business

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent, age 38, has offered salon services for the past six years in Ngong. She was married and is now separated. She is blessed with four children. She earns an income of KES.13,000 per month.

Millicent is applying for her first loan of KES.20,000 from KADET Ltd, which she plans to use to buy more cosmetics for her salon. She will use the extra profit generated from the loan to grow her business and to improve her children's standard of living.

Millicent hopes one day to have a hairdressing school and to ensure that her family has everything they need.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for her salon

loans.name: Aura Dilia

texts.es: La señora Aura es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su familia , Aura está muy contenta por  los financiamiento obtenidos atravez de kiva , ya que su vida a mejorado en cuanto a la calidad de vida , ya que ahora su casita está hecha la gran parte de bloque y eso le permite tener más seguridad en su propia casa , ella tiene el apoyo de su esposo ya que labora en una empresa privada , para poyarle con  los gastos del hogar ya que tienen dos hijos que estudian y necesitan de su apoyo , doña Aura desde hace varios labora en una casa privada . El préstamo lo quiere para realizar una división y necesita comprar bloque , cemento , arena , entre otros productos para la construcción .
texts.en: Sra. Aura lives with her family in the town of Ticuantepe.  She tells us that she is very grateful for Kiva loans because she has been able to use them to improve her quality of life.  She used a past loan to rebuild her house with cement blocks, making it safer for her and her family.  Aura's husband works for a private company and the couple share household expenses.  They have two children, both in school.  Aura works as a cleaner.  She plans to use this loan to improve her house.  She will buy everything she needs for the construction: cement blocks, concrete, sand, etc.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu operates a grocery business, selling her goods at retail. She and her husband Hassan have four children between the ages of four and 12, three of whom are enrolled in school. Hassan works as a teacher. The family lives in a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Mwanamkuu started her grocery business three years ago, before which she worked as a farmer. Her primary customers are the members of her local community. 

Mwanamkuu's other source of income includes selling flat bread, popular in the area as a breakfast item. She describes her greatest business challenge to be the high cost goods and her highest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanamkuu joined Yehu to access funds. She will use her Kes 20,000 loan to purchase sacks of tomatoes, onions, and fruits to offer for sale. Mwanamkuu aspires to establish a food stall business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, onions, and fruits to offer for sale

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Since receiving her previous loan, Hoa and her husband's business of making pallets has been running smoothly. This has helped her to better provide for her family. 

To increase her sales, she would like to take out another loan to expand production and to buy materials in bulk. She is confident that this will enable her to earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials for making pallets in bulk

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is requesting another loan for 80,000 KES, which she will use to establish another business of selling clothes. With the loan, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. With the previous loan, Fatuma's monthly income increased  by 50 percent and with the additional profits she was able to provide basic needs to her family.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es: La socia continua con su negocio y apoyando a su esposo con la carpinteria, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y apoya en todo lo que puede y a aprendido mucho del trabajo que realiza su esposo, en esta ocasion la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de madera para terminar de elaborar los diferentes trabajos  como puertas y marcos de ventanas.
texts.en: Lilian keeps on working with and supporting her husband in his carpenter’s workshop. She is a very hardworking woman, she supports her husband anyway she can and she has learnt a lot about her husband’s job. In this occasion she is requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of wood in order to finish working on various products such as doors and window frames.

loans.use: To buy wood for her carpenter's workshop.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah, 24 years old and married to Jared, is the mother of one child. For the past two years, Serah has been a green grocer in the Kingstone area of Nairobi, earning an income of KES.24,000 per month.

Now applying for her first loan of KES.20,000 from KADET LTD to buy stocks of bananas, cabbages, kale, and onions, Serah will put the extra profits toward establishing another business as well as expanding her current enterprise. She hopes to have a better future and be able to give her child a good education.

loans.use: to buy stocks of cabbages, bananas, kale and onions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary, 44 years old, married to James, and the mother of five children, has been offering salon services to the residents of Lucky Summer for the last three years, earning an income of KES.7,000 per month. Now applying for her first loan of KES.20,000 from KADET LTD to buy new equipment for her salon, Mary will use the resulting extra profits to expand her business and educate her children. She hopes to have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for her salon.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 40 years old, married and has four children. She earns a living by selling cereals and has been in the business for the past 14 years. This is her first term loan from KADET LTD. She was brought to KADET LTD  by a staff member. She will use this loan to buy beans, peas and other items to stock in her business. She hopes to start selling cereals wholesale in the future.

loans.use: to buy beans, peas and other items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.fr: Le client est  entrepreneur, armateur- pécheur  de fretins sur le lac Kivu,  âgé de 43  ans, marié, père de 5 jeunes enfants, qui étudient tous. Il s’entraide avec son épouse dans les activités de pêcherie. Il y a  6 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, il vient d’obtenir  son  14eme  crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  10 nouveaux filets, etc.  En plus, il souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement, accroitre son entreprise et construire en dur.  Le client remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres operateur en faible investissement  exclus de banque classique.
texts.en:
The client is an entrepreneur. He is a boat-owner and fisherman on Lake Kivu. He is 43, married, and the father of five young children who all go to school. He and his wife help each other with fishing activities. This has been his source of income for the last six years. 

He has just obtained his 14th loan from Hekima. This new loan will allow him to buy 10 new nets, etc. Also, he would like to see his children grow up in comfort, expand his business and build a permanent home. 

He is grateful to Hekima for all they do for small business owners who do not have much to invest, and who are not able to work with traditional banks.

loans.use: to pay for ten new nets, etc..

loans.name: Dalis Ester

texts.es: Dalis de 51 años, tiene dos hijos en las edades de 17 y 29 años de edad y  se dedica a la preparación de productos derivados de la harina de trigo, los cuales vende en bandejas de icopor; sus principales líneas  son deditos, empanaditas de carne, queso, dulce de guayaba, bolitas de carne, de trigo etc. Estos productos los distribuyen bandejas entre pequeños comerciantes de Soledad, o para el consumo de las amas de casa que son sus vecinas y conocidos del sector, mediante venta directa y de contado. Su negocio lo inició un vez aprendió esta actividad en la ciudad de Cartagena y una vez radicada en la ciudad de Barranquilla,  inició su proceso de preparación para generar ingresos. Su meta es expandir su mercado hacia la ciudad de Cartagena y enfocarse también en Barranquilla.  Su mayor desafío es la competencia la cual debe enfrentar diariamente ofreciendo productos de mayor calidad, con un buen estándar de su preparación. En la actualidad Dalis está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una batidora semi industrial, una licuadora y una vitrina exhibidora.
texts.en: Dalis, 51, has two children, 29- and 17-years old, respectively.  She operates a business making and selling prepared foods.  She makes deditos, empanadas, etc., plates them on plastic trays and sells the trays on to her friends and neighbors or to the small shops in her neighborhood.  She started the business in Barranquilla after picking up the relevant skills for it in Cartagena.  She supports herself with income from the business.  Her goal is to expand her customer base to include customers in Cartagena as well as customers in Barranquilla.  Her biggest challenge is competition from other similar businesses.  She has to make better products, prepared to an ever-higher standard.  Dalis is applying for a Kiva loan, supported by Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, that she will use to buy a commercial-grade mixer, a blender and a display case.

loans.use: to buy kitchen applicances for her food business.

loans.name: Marco Alexander

texts.es: El socio Marco Alexander, aun continua con su pequeño cafetin, el junto a su esposa se han dedicado a la atencion de su cafetin y desea que siga prosperando el negocio, el socio requiere el prestamo para terminar de implementar el negocio el comprara un estereo y tambien algunas mesas y sillas.
texts.en: Our member, Marco Alexander, and his wife operate a restaurant business.  He used past loans to start the business and he wants to grow it now.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to buy a stereo, tables and chairs for the business.

loans.use: to buy a stereo, tables and chairs for his restaurant business.

loans.name: Matenah

texts.en:
Matenah lives in Sinkor. She is twenty-nine years old, single, and has a seven-year-old child that lives at home and goes to school. 

For the past year she has been selling cement. She started this business from her savings. She makes lots of profit and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cement for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more cement  for her business.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is thirty-six years old and married to George.They live in Nakuru and have been blessed with one child. S

he has been selling curtains in Nakuru town for the last three years. She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of curtains to sell. 

In the future, Khadija hopes to establish a bigger business store and sell curtains wholesale thereby making more profit.

loans.use: To buy more stock of curtains to sell.

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en:
Saidi is a forty-four-year-old married man. He has three children and all are enrolled in school. Saidi operates a motorcycle transport business and sells his services at the market. He's worked in this business for two years and was previously employed selling clothes. His primary customers are neighbours. Saidi's other source of income includes a fish selling business. He describes his greatest business challenge to be high cost of purchasing fuel and his highest monthly expense is food. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Saidi will use the KES 30,000 loan to add to his savings so that he has enough to purchase another motorcycle. Saidi aspires to have a fleet of motor bikes in the future. He joined Yehu to access funds.

loans.use: to add to his savings to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, leader du groupe d’affaire «Ubumwe », est entrepreneur, âgée de 48 ans,  veuve, remariée récemment  par un mâcon constructeur. Mère de 3 jeunes enfants, qui étudient tous. Elle est vendeuse de braises, pommes de terre, farines, etc. Elle expose des articles à son domicile devant  sa porte. Elle fut cultivatrice dans son village avant de s’installer dans la ville de Goma. Depuis sa jeunesse, elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  2eme  crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  2 sacs de pommes de terre, etc.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et ouvrir une boutique.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent gentiment leurs bébés.
texts.en:
The leader of the "Ubumwe" group is an entrepreneur. She is a 48-year old widow who recently remarried a mason/builder. She has three young children who all go to school. 

She sells charcoal, potatoes, flour, etc. She displays the merchandise in front of her house. Previously, she was a market gardener in her village before moving to the town of Goma. Since a young age, she has been carrying out these small, revenue-producing activities. 

She has just obtained her second loan from Hekima. This new loan will allow her to buy two sacks of potatoes, etc. In addition, she would like to see her children grow up in comfort, and open a shop. 

She thanks Hekima for helping poor women who cannot turn to traditional banks. Note that in the photo, some of the women are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to pay for two sacks of potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana María continua con su negocio de venta de cosméticos. la socia es conocida por sus amistades en la venta de productos de belleza por catalogos; La socia en esta ocasión desea poder invertir en la compra de cosmeticos como perfumes, talcos, colonias, cremas que estan en oferta comprarlas para luego distribuirlas.
texts.en: Ana María continues with her business selling cosmetics.  She’s well known by her acquaintances for selling beauty products via catalogue.
