Nohemí es socia del Banco Comunal “las Mujeres de Santa Rosa de Arapa II”  ubicado en el distrito de Arapa, provincia  Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, cuenta con estudios superiores.
 
Nohemí se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 6 meses, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.

Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevo soles comprará 30 cajas de gaseosas y otras mercaderías como azúcar, golosinas, galletas, arroz, etc, lo vende en las ferias de la localidad.

Su sueño para el futuro  es seguir trabajando con el negocio y tener una tienda más grande.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la organización, la facilidad del préstamo y la cuenta interna.
texts.en:
Nohemí’s a member of the “Las Mujeres de Santa Rosa de Arapa II” communal bank in Arapa District, Azángano Province and Puno Department.  She’s 28 years old, single and has no children.  She has higher education.

Nohemí sells groceries.  She’s worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last 6 months.  Her first loan was in the amount of 500 new soles that she invested in her business.  She will use her new, 800 new sol, loan to buy 30 cases of soft drinks and other merchandise like sugar, snacks, cookies, rice, etc. that she sells in the local street markets.

Her dream for the future is to continue working in her business and to have a larger store.  What she likes best about her communal bank is the ease of the loan and the internal account.

loans.use: to buy 30 cases of soft-drinks, sugar, snacks, cookies, rice, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a widow from Talibon, Bohol. She has 4 children that she takes care of. Victoria has had a sari-sari store business for 2 years. She sells items like canned goods, instant noodles and soft drinks. Victoria works hard to provide for her children's basic needs. She also makes sure to pay for her children's school fees.

Victoria has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as rice, soap and soft drinks. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as rice, soap and soft drinks

loans.name: Tat

texts.en: Tat would like to take another loan to buy more chickens for resale. Tat's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. Tat hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to sell

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita, age 51, earns a living by baking and selling bread within her community. She has operated this business for 10 years and earns about 5000 PHP per month. 

She is in need of additional capital, so she has applied for a loan from CEVI. She plans to use her loan to buy ingredients for making bread, such as flour, sugar, margarine, and oil. 

Anecita hopes to build a bakery in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making bread, such as flour, sugar, margarine, and oil

loans.name: Angel Segundo

texts.es:
Angel Segundo tiene 48 años de edad es casado tiene 5 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en Guaranda provincia de bo9lívar.
La VRC Emmanuel está conformada por 12 socios esta ventanilla queda a 40 minutos de la oficina ubicada en el recinto San Juan de Llullundongo perteneciente a Guaranda.
Angel se dedica a ala agricultura a la siembra de papas, maíz, además cría pollos, cerdos, ganado.
Solicita el crédito actual para comprar abonos, urea,  fertilizantes, líquidos mata plagas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá salvar la producción.
Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda cada 15 días. El sueño es poder tener un vehículo que sea propio. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es el transporte y el clima.
 En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar boly y disfrutar de las fechas del carnaval.


Angel esta muy agradecido por la ayuda del CREDITO ANTERIOR porque ha trabajado y comprado los insumos para los cultivos y obtener màs ingresos Para cubrir las neceisdades de la familia.
texts.en:
Ángel Segundo, 48, is married and has five children.  He lives with his wife and children in Guaranda Province, Bolívar.

The “Emmanuel” communal bank has 12 members and is located 40 minutes from the office located in Recinto San Juan de Llullundongo belonging to Guaranda.

Ángel farms potatoes and corn and also raises chickens, pigs and cattle.  He requests this loan to buy manure, urea, fertilizer and liquids to kill bugs.  With help from the loan he will be able to save his harvest.

His purchases and sales take place in Guaranda every 15 days.  His dream is to have a vehicle of his own.  The challenges he faces are transportation and the weather.  In his free time he enjoys playing volleyball and the Carnival season.

Ángel is very grateful for the help from the previous loan because he’s worked and purchased supplies for the crops to obtain more income to cover family needs.

loans.use: to buy manure, urea, fertilizer and liquids to kill bugs.

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em's previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income to support his family. Em would now like to request another loan to buy rabbits and feed for his rabbits. He hopes that through the loan, he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy rabbits and feed for his rabbits

loans.name: Baluki Plus Group

texts.en:
Vadi, aged 43, is the chairwoman of the Community Bank named “Baluki Plus.” It is composed of 11 members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Vadi has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 1980. She sells smoked and salted fish. Her business is located in the eastern part of Kinshasa. She is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having four times obtained and correctly repaid loans. 

With her next loan she is planning to increase her inventory by buying four boxes of salted fish with the goal of increasing her profits. Her business generates a profit of about $180 per week. Vadi’s ambition is to grow her business and open a beverage facility. She is married and the mother of five children whose ages range from 12 and 36 years. Three of them attend school.

loans.use: to increase inventory by buying four boxes of salted fish to resell at profit.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Fifty-three-year-old Julita is a married woman with five adult children. She sells fish for a living. Julita buys fish from fishermen in her town and then sells them at the market. She also runs a small sari-sari store where she sells items like snacks, soy sauce, vinegar and canned goods. Julita works hard to help support her family.

Julita has requested a loan to buy salt, ice boxes and more items to sell at her store. Julita hopes for her businesses to prosper.

loans.use: to buy salt, ice boxes and more items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Joaquim

texts.pt:
Nasceu no distrito de Buzi , Província de Sofala, Centro de Moçambique, casado e pai de 3 filhos dos quais 2 frequentam a Escola e o outro ainda bebé. Fez a 7ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos seus pais, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais uma irmã que vive com ele. 


Saiu de Buzi para Maputo no distrito de Boane a procura de emprego. Trabalha como motorista há mais de 2 anos e tem um salário de 6.000.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).

Nunca teve empréstimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (cimento, e areia, para fazer blocos). O empréstimo anterior foi de 20.000.00mt para habitação.  
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e mobilar, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
He was born in the district of Buzi, province of Sofala, central Mozambique. He's married and has three children - two of them attend school and the other one is still a baby. He completed 7th grade and stopped because his parents lacked financial conditions. He lives with his family in a house he owns and also supports a sister who lives with him.
He left Buzi for Maputo in the district of Boane in search of a job. He has worked as a driver for over two years and earns a salary of 6.000mt. He uses it to pay for home expenses and also saves part of it in his bank account.
He has never had loans with other banks. He first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is his second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 10.000mt, which he intends to use to purchase construction supplies in order to build his house (cement and sand for making bricks). The previous loan was for 20.000mt, for housing expenses.
He pledges to make his repayments as scheduled. In the future he intends to finish building and furnishing his home, and for that purpose he plans to request other loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies to build his home (cement and sand for making bricks).

loans.name: Norelis

texts.es: Norelis es una confeccionista de 30 años, que tiene un hijo de un año de edad, con el que sueña un futuro exitoso y es el motor de su vida. Norelis confecciona de ropa   informal, multiusos, ropa interior e infantil en general, negocio que inició hace 7 años y que ella con sus esfuerzos, lo ha hecho crecer   y en la actualidad confecciona para distribuidores, a quienes les vende por docenas y principalmente de contado. Norelis está empeñada en que su negocio crezca, pero su mayor desafío es el capital de trabajo con el que cuenta para responder a sus necesidades de expansión. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará telas, hilos, elásticos y accesorios para confeccionar diseños modernos.  Su inversión será exitosa porque la hace en base a su experiencia y con un nuevo capital de trabajo con el cual ella no contaba.
texts.en: Norelis is a 30 year old seamstress who has a 1 year old son. She dreams of a successful future for him and he is the motor of her life. Norelis makes informal, multi-use clothing, underwear and general children's clothing.  She started this business 7 years ago and with her hard work she had made it grow. Now she makes clothes for distributors whom she sells to by the dozen and mainly up front. Norelis is dedicated to making her business grow but her biggest challenge is the working capital she has to respond to her expanding needs. That is why she has turned to her Kiva loan, the first loan she has taken out with  the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will buy fabric, thread, elastic and accessories to make modern designs. Her investment will be successful because it is based on her experience and with new working capital that she didn't have.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic and accessories to make modern designs.

loans.name: Lidia Luz

texts.es:
La señora Lidia Luz es casada, tiene 48 años de edad, cursó los 6años de educacion primaria, tiene 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a costura y al bordado, lleva 7 años de experiencia, apenas inicia este negocio, cuenta con el apoyo de su apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

Solicita un préstamo que utilizara como capital de trabajo, para compra de hilos y telas, para mejo5ar su producción de bordados, en el futuro quiere ver un negocio con mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Lidia Luz is 48 years old and married.  She has a sixth grade education.  She has two children, and they go to school.  

She devotes herself to sewing and embroidery.  She has seven years of experience, and she just started this business.  She has her husband’s support; he devotes himself to commerce.

She is requesting a loan for working capital to buy thread and fabric in order to improve her embroidery production.  In the future she wants to see a business with better income.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread for embroidery.

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en: Hoang's previous loan enabled him to repair his motorcycle and increase his income through his work as a motorcycle taxi driver. Hoang would now like to take another loan to buy a greater quantity of soft drinks and coffee to stock a cafe that he runs with his wife. He hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of soft drinks and coffee

loans.name: Resurrection Plus Group

texts.en:
Mado is the chairwoman of the Community Bank named “Resurrection Plus” which is composed of 10 members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Mado, 48, became a micro-entrepreneur in 1991. She sells vegetable oil, corn seeds, and manioc in the southwestern part of Kinshasa. She likes her business and works hard with good management skills in order to realize her dream of one day opening a large store in her area. Her business brings in $40 per week. Mado is a trustworthy client of MFI HOPE RDC, having nine times received and correctly repaid loans. 

With this loan, she will increase her stock of merchandise by purchasing corn seeds, cassava and vegetable oil to resell at a profit. Mado is married and the mother of six children whose ages are between 3 and 26 years. Five of them attend school.

loans.use: to buy corn, cassava and vegetable oil to resell at a profit.

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en: Pictured here is Memuna. Born in 1970, in Kono, Eastern Sierra Leone, Memuna is married to a guest house staffer. The couple has three children who attend secondary and tertiary institutions. For 20 years, Memuna has been a businesswoman. Currently, she sells market food: palm oil, onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), pepper, etc.. She is seeking a loan of 5,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to further expand her business. With this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her existing stock.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, margi, pepper, etc. at wholesale to increase her stock.

loans.name: Joao

texts.pt:
Nasceu no distrito de Boane , Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 6 filhos todos frequentam a Escola. Fez a 3ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos seus pais, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 


Trabalha como tractorista na Bananalândia há mais de 8 anos e tem um salário de26.500.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).

Já teve empréstimo no BIM e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (cimento, areia, pedra, ferro, e outros). O empréstimo anterior foi de 10.000.00mt para habitação.  
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
He was born in the district of Boane, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. He's married and has six children, all of which attend school. He completed 3rd grade and stopped because his parents lacked financial conditions. He lives with his family in a house he owns and does not support anyone else.
He has worked as a tractor driver for the Bananalândia company for over 8 years and earns a salary of 26.500mt. He uses it to pay for home expenses and also saves part of it in his bank account.
He has had a loan with BIM and has managed to repay it without difficulties. He first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is his second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 10.000mt, which he intends to use to purchase construction supplies in order to build his house (cement, sand, rocks, iron, etc.). The previous loan was for 10.000mt, for housing expenses.
He pledges to make his repayments as scheduled. In the future he intends to finish building his home, and for that purpose he plans to request other loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies to build his home (cement, sand, rocks, iron, etc.).

loans.name: Alice

texts.pt:
Nasceu no distrito de Boane , Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 4 filhos dos quais apenas um ainda frequenta a Escola os outros maiores de idade. Fez a 8ª classe e um curso para formação de professores, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 


É professora há mais de 30 anos e tem um salário de 4.000.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).

Nunca teve empréstimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (blocos, cimento, areia, pedra, ferro, e outros). Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt, e 10.000.00mt, para habitação.  
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e mobilar, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Boane, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She's single and has four children - only one of them is still in school, the others are adults. She completed 8th grade and studied to become a teacher. She lives with her family in a house she owns and does not support anyone else.
She has been a teacher for over 30 years and earns a salary of 4.000mt. She uses it to pay for home expenses and also saves part of it in her bank account.
She has never had loans in other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku. It is for 10.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase construction supplies fin order to build her house (bricks, cement, sand, rocks, iron, etc). The previous loans were for 10.000mt, 10.000mt and 10.000mt, for housing expenses.
She pledges to make her repayments as scheduled. In the future she intends to finish building and furnishing her home, and for that purpose she plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies to build her home (bricks, cement, sand, rocks, iron, etc).

loans.name: Komba Umaru

texts.en: Here is Komba, a small-scale businessman in Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. Komba sells ready-to-wear-clothes. He has had this business for twenty-three years. With a loan of 4,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL), the thirty-three-year-old will buy clothes in bulk to add to his business. With a larger quantity of clothes in his shop, he will be able to attract many customers, make more sales and a better profit. A native of Koidu, Komba is married to a businesswoman and the couple has two children who are attending primary school.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy drinks like Star Beer (a popular local brand), Stout, etc.

loans.name: Tengbe Sahr

texts.en: Here is Tengbe, a small-scale businessman in Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. Tengbe sells clothes, poplins, etc. Tengbe has been doing business for sixteen years. With a loan of 5,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL), he will buy clothes and sewing materials like poplins, etc. to sell. The forty-year-old Tengbe is a husband with three children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children attend primary schools.

loans.use: to buy clothes and sewing materials, like poplins, to sell.

loans.name: Sia

texts.en:
Sia is approximately 35 years old. She was born in Bayana-Tonkoro, in Eastern Sierra Leone. Sia is a wife and a mother of two children. Her husband is a diamond miner and her children attend primary and secondary schools. Sia has been a businesswoman for 20 years. She sells plastic bowls, buckets, etc. 

Sia has requested a loan of 5,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) from Kiva's field partner, Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), in order to expand her business. She will use the loan to buy plastic bowls, buckets, etc. at wholesale to increase her inventory. In this way, her business will grow, attracting many customers.

loans.use: to buy plastic bowls, buckets, etc. at wholesale to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Kumba Nyama

texts.en:
Kumba is approximately thirty five years old. She was born in Koidu, where she currently lives with her husband and two children. Her husband is a private diamond miner and her children attend secondary school. Kumba has been a businesswoman for six years. She sells both soft and hard drinks. 

Kumba has requested a loan of 5,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) from Kiva's field partner, Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), in order to expand her business (both in terms of size and quality). She will use the loan to buy Star Beer (a local brand), Stout, etc. in larger quantities to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy Star Beer, Stout, etc. in larger quantities to add to her business.

loans.name: Adelaide

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, Sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 4 filhos todos frequentam a Escola. Fez a 5ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais um sobrinho, uma nora, e uma neta. 


É negociante há mais de 12 anos dedica-se a compra e revenda de produtos diversos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BCI).

Já teve empréstimo na ECCOM e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 8.000.00mt, com qual pretende produtos (feijão, farinha, óleo, arroz, refrescos, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. O empréstimo anterior foi de 5.500.00mt, aplicado no negócio.  

Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende ampliar o seu negócio, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the town of Maputo, province of the same name, southern Mozambique. She's single and has four children, all of which attend school. She completed 5th grade and stopped because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports a nephew, a daughter-in-law and a granddaughter.
She has been a businesswoman for over 12 years. She buys and sells various products and earns an income of about 6.000mt. She uses it to pay for home expenses and also saves part of it in her bank account.
She has had a loan with ECCOM and has managed to repay it without difficulties. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 8.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase goods (beans, flour, oil, rice, refreshments, etc.) in order to increase the quantity of her merchandise. The previous loan was for 5.500mt and it was used for her business.
She pledges to make her repayments as scheduled. In the future she intends to expand her business, and for that purpose she plans to request other loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase goods for selling (beans, flour, oil, rice, refreshments, etc.).

loans.name: Shahrabonu

texts.ru: Шахрабону уже 7 лет занимается купле - продажей топлива. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Она берет кредит для закупа топлива.
texts.en: Shahrabonu has been buying and reselling fuel for seven years now. She is 47 years old, married and has three children. She is taking out the loan to buy fuel.

loans.use: to buy fuel.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Chibuto, Província de Gaza, Sul de Moçambique, viúva e mãe de 6 filhos dos quais 2 frequentam a Escola e os outros já formaram suas famílias. Nunca teve oportunidade de Frequentar a Escola por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 


É negociante há mais de 15 anos dedica-se a compra e revenda de produtos alimentares e tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).

Nunca teve empréstimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para obra da sua casa (ferro, pedra, cimento, areia, blocos, e outros). O empréstimo anterior foi de 5.000.00mt, aplicado na habitação.  

Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in Chibuto, province of Gaza, southern Mozambique. She's a widow and has six children - two of them attend school, the others already have their own families. She never had the opportunity to go to school because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and does not support anyone else.
She has been a businesswoman for over 15 years. She buys and sells foodstuffs and earns an income of about 3.000mt. She uses it to pay for home expenses and also saves part of it in her bank account.
She has never had loans in other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 10.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase construction supplies in order to build her house (iron, rocks, cement, sand, bricks, etc). The previous loan was for 5.000mt, for housing expenses.
She pledges to make her repayments as scheduled. In the future she intends to finish building her home, and for that purpose she plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies to build her home (iron, rocks, cement, sand, bricks, etc.).

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: El socio Jaime continua con su agencia de viajes el socio invertira en la compra de algunos muebles para implementar su agencia de viajes. El socio invertira en la compra de armarios, televisor.
texts.en: The member, Jaime, is continuing with his travel agency.  He will use the money to buy some new furniture for the agency.  He will purchase cabinets and a television set.

loans.use: to buy some cabinets and a television set

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a 49-year-old married woman with five children.  She has run a sari-sari store (general store) business for three years.  Angelina sells items like coffee, sugar, vinegar, cooking oil and canned goods.  Angelina also sells gasoline to the members of her community.  She earns about 5,000 PHP per month with her business.

Angelina is in need of additional capital for her business.  She has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, instant noodles, snacks and gasoline.  This loan will help increase the profitability of Angelina's business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, instant noodles, snacks and gasoline.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a married woman with six children between the ages of 10 and 27.  Four of her children still attend school.  Carmelita's husband works as a carpenter.

Carmelita is in the business of raising pigs.  She says that she hopes to expand her backyard piggery and build a better shelter for the pigs that she raises.  She plans to use her loan to buy piglets, feed and vitamins.  Carmelita hopes for her business to grow.  She also hopes to be able to continue to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Wilson Gilberto

texts.es:
Wilson Gilberto tiene 42 años de edad es casado tiene 6 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en Guaranda provincia de bolívar.
La VRC Emmanuel está conformada por 12 socios esta ventanilla queda a 40 minutos de la oficina ubicada en el recinto San Juan de Llullundongo perteneciente a Guaranda.
Wilson se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas, maíz, leche, además tiene ganado, pollos y cerdos.
Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, abono orgánico, urea. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá adquirir los fertilizantes para trabajar en los cultivos.
Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda cada 15 días.El sueño es poder tener un vehículo que sea propio. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son los intermediarios, transporte y el mal clima. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar boly y disfrutar de las fechas del carnaval.

"esta muy agradecido por el CREDITO ANTERIOR y por confiar en ellos porque han cumplido con los pagos establecidos del crèdito."
texts.en:
Wilson Gilberto is 42 years old, married and has 6 children. He lives with his wife and children in Guaranda,  province of Bolívar. The 
Emmanuel communal bank is made up of 12 members. This bank is 40 minutes from the office located in the community of San Juan de Llullundongo, which is in Guaranda.

Wilson is a farmer who grows potatoes and corn. He also produces milk and has cattle, chicken and pigs. He is asking for the loan to buy fertilizer and manure for his crops. He does his buying and selling in Guaranda every two weeks. His dream is to be able to have a vehicle of his own. The challenges he faces are the intermediaries, transportation and bad weather. In his free time he likes to play volleyball and enjoy the carnival season.  

"he is very grateful for the PREVIOUS LOAN and for the trust put in him because he has made his payments on time."

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, and urea.

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is a 45-year-old married man who has six children, four of whom are adults who live together in Taiz, Yemen. He decided to establish a spices (Bharat) shop which is a source of income to live on. He would sell the basics (beans, rice, flour, eggs, coffee, dairy products, meat, sausages, canned goods, bread, and soup packets, etc.). 

He started it through his own efforts, and he has managed to gradually stock the store. He devotes the whole day to this business in order to help his family. 

He requested a loan of 150,000 Yemeni Rial (YER) from AMB to stock his store with basic needs products like beans, rice, flour, sugar, lentils, eggs, coffee, raisins, etc. He will do this in order to continue selling and to give his customers better service. 

In the future, Adnan hopes to work with his own capital in order to stock his business, have a better quality of life, and expand his business to open another spices shop.

loans.use: to buy basic needs products like beans, rice, flour,sugar, lentils, eggs, coffee and raisins for his business.

loans.name: Eileen

texts.en:
Eileen is a 48-year-old married woman with five children aged 22, 20, 19, 17 and 11. Her husband works as a driver.

Eileen is a food vendor.  She sells grilled hotdogs, tempura and fried chicken to the members of her community.  She has been in this business for two years.  Eileen earns about 6,000 PHP per month with this business.  She plans to use her loan to buy hotdogs, tempura, chicken, oil, sugar and sticks. 

Eileen hopes that this loan will help her grow her business.

loans.use: to buy hotdogs, tempura, chicken, oil, sugar and sticks.

loans.name: Abdulhafiz

texts.en:
Abdulhafiz is a 38-year-old married who has five children. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. 

He studied up to a bachelor's degree. He has worked very hard for many years to get his family ahead and give them everything they deserve. 

He has a grocery store and it is his main source of income. 

He started his business three years ago. His business was initially started with limited capital and didn't run well enough to get much profit.

His business is located in a very strategic area. Many people prefer his store because he always has the basic staples at accessible prices, and he provides the best possible customer service. His dream is to see his store flourish. 

Due to the current bad situation in Yemen, he has less profit from his enterprise. 

So, he took a loan of 80,000 Yemeni Rial (YER) from AMB to stock his business with more products such as eggs, cheese, soft drinks, and mineral water so that his customers will always find what they need and keep coming back. 

In the future, Abdulhafiz would like to study for a master's degree in his specialization and hopes to be able to get his family ahead and give them better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to stock more products such as eggs, cheese, soft drinks and mineral water for his business.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a pig grower from Tagbilaran, Bohol. She is 46 years old, married, and has three children. Estrella has been raising pigs for five years. She works hard to support her family and provide for their household needs.

Estrella needs additional capital for her business. She requested a loan to buy additional feed, vitamins, and piglets to raise. Estrella hopes for her income to improve. She said she hopes for her family to continue eating three times a day and be in good health always.

loans.use: to buy additional feed, vitamins and piglets to raise

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon lives in the Coastal town of Changamwe, Kenya. He is a married father of three children and operates a taxi business. The business has been running for twenty years. He purchased the "old car" as he calls it, from the savings he had kept to start the business. 

Gideon was introduced to Milango by his friends and is applying for a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to repair his car and to repaint it to attract more customers. 

Gideon's car does not meet the standard and the taste of most of the current customers. His aim is to upgrade the type of vehicle he uses and he is ready to save the additional income from this loan towards purchasing another car in the future. The challenges he faces while doing this business are high fuel costs and competition from the other operators.

loans.use: To repair his car and to repaint it to attract more customers.

loans.name: Jonatán Ely

texts.es:
Jonatan Ely, tiene 52 años de edad, casado, tiene 3 hijos de 14,16 y 18 años de edad, vive en una aldea de Peña Blanca, Cortes.
Jonatan, es muy trabajador, el tiene establecido un negocio de pulpería, donde vende productos alimenticios como arroz, frijoles, verduras, refrescos, pan, churros, pastillas etc. En la pulpería le ayuda mucho su esposa. También genera otros ingresos, distribuye condimentos y especias a otros  negocios y compra y repara aparatos electrónicos. La pulpería la ha mantenido desde hace 7 años haciendo inversiones de sus ganancias y ofreciendo productos con mejores precios y buena atención al cliente.
Esta solicitando este préstamo de 17,000.00 Lempiras para reparar el vehículo que ocupa en su negocio, con el cual reparte condimentos y especias a los demás negocios.
Su meta es tener siempre surtido el negocio para satisfacer las necesidades del cliente y crecer más
texts.en:
Jonatan Ely, age 52, is married and has three children, ages 14, 16, and 18.  He lives in the village of Peña Blanca, Cortes.

Jonatan is a very hard-worker.  He has established a grocery store business where he sells food products like rice, beans, vegetables, soft drinks, bread, churros, and bouillon cubes, etc.  His wife helps him a lot in the store.

He also generates other income by distributing condiments and spices to other businesses.  He also buys and repairs electronic apparatus.  He has had the grocery store for seven years.  He invests his earnings in his business, he offers products for the best prices, and he takes good care of his customers.

He is requesting a loan for 17,000 lempiras to repair the vehicle that he uses in his business.  He uses it to distribute condiments and spices to the other businesses.

His goal is to always have the business well stocked in order to satisfy his customers needs and to grow more.

loans.use: to repair the vehicle he uses for work in order to distribute his products.

loans.name: Carmen Isaura

texts.es:
Carmen Isaura tiene 37 años de edad es casada tiene 4 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos, vive en GUARANDA provincia de Bolívar .
La VRC Emmanuel está conformada por 12 socios esta ventanilla queda a 40 minutos de la oficina ubicada en el recinto San Juan de Llullundongo perteneciente a Guaranda.
Carmen se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas, maíz, además cría cerdos y pollos.
Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, abono, urea, líquidos mata plagas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá salvar los cultivos de las plasgas.
Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda semanalmente.
El sueño es poder tener una camioneta para transportar los productos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son los intermediarios y el transporte.
 En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar y ver televisión.

Carmen esta muy agradecida por el CREDITO ANTERIOR porque ha sido de mucha ayuda para trabajar y comprar los insumos para los cultivos y obtener màs ingresos Para el beneficio de la familia.
texts.en:
Carmen Isaura is 37 years old.  She is married with four children and they live in Guaranda, in the province of Bolívar.  The Emmanuel Communal Bank is comprised of twelve members and is located 40 minutes from the office in San Juan de Llullundongo precinct, Guaranda.

Carmen works in agriculture planting potatoes and corn.  She also raises pigs and chickens.  She is requesting the loan to purchase compost, fertilizer, urea, and liquid pesticides. With the help of this loan, she will be able to protect her crops frominsect infestations. She makes weekly purchases and sales in Guaranda.  Her dream is to own a truck to transport her products.  She faces challenges dealing with the middle-men and transporting her products.  During her free time, she rests and watches television.  

Carmen is very grateful for the previous loan because it helped her to carry on her work and buy supplies for the crops, and in this way, earn more income for the benefit of her family.

loans.use: to purchase compost, fertilizer, urea, and liquid pesticides.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Элмире 47 лет, замужем. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Элмира занимается животноводством.  Начатое в 2008 году с покупки крупного рогатого скота хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи молока и молочной продукции. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Элмира обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота на откорм и перепродажу. Доходы Элмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, а ближе к лету – сделать ремонт в жилом доме.
texts.en: Elmira is 47 years old, married. As a source of income for the family Elmira does animal husbandry. She started the business in 2008 buying large horned cattle which now brings around 5,000 som (KGS) a month from the sale of milk and dairy products. Elmira has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 80,000 KGS to buy livestock for fattening and resale with the purpose to further grow her business. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further increase of the number of livestock and to do repairs at her home closer to the summer.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: La socia Yolanda; continua con su negocio de cafetín en el mismo colegio la socia ahora que comenzaran las labores en los colegios en general ella desea poder implementar el cafetin y comprar todo lo referente a golosinas, gaseosas, galletas, productos en general para implementar su negocio y vender, la socia desea comprar todo tipo de productos para la venta de sanwich, tes, mates, jugos entre otros.
texts.en: The member, Yolanda continues managing her small café at the same school and now is beginning to work in other schools.  She wishes to stock her café with candy, soda, cookies, and general products that she can sell.  She also wishes to purchase sandwiches, teas, bread, juice, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase soda, bread, candy, cookies, and other items.

loans.name: Iyabodè Elisabeth

texts.fr: Iyabodè Elisabeth est âgée de 43 ans et est mariée à un certain Arouna. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. La famille vit ensemble. Iyabodè Elisabeth assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges familiales. Iyabodè Elisabeth n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses différents besoins, Iyabodè Elisabeth vend depuis quinze ans des ustensiles de cuisine (glacières, casseroles, gobelets, etc.) des biscuits, des bombons et des vêtements à travers un système de distribution. Iyabodè Elisabeth s’approvisionne au Nigeria et parfois à Lomé. En vue de renforcer davantage son activité par l’augmentation du stock de ses produits, afin de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Iyabodè Elisabeth sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Iyabodè Elisabeth is 43 years old and married to a man called Arouna.  The couple has six children, all in school and all their dependents.  The whole family lives together. Iyabodè Elisabeth and her husband jointly take care of the household expenses.  
Iyabodè Elisabeth never attended school.  In order to meet her various needs, she has been selling kitchen utensils (ice-boxes, sauce-pans, cups etc.), as well as cookies, candy and clothes, through a distribution system, for the past fifteen years.  She buys her merchandise in Nigeria and sometimes in Lomé.  
Iyabodè Elisabeth is requesting financial support from ALIDé in order to increase her stock of merchandise, strengthen her activity, and in the end, better satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils (ice boxes, saucepans etc.), clothes and boxes of cookies and candy.

loans.name: Nonvignon Group

texts.fr: NONVIGNON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Blandine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à un certain Maximin. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés mais seulement trois restent à leur charge. Blandine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis dix sept ans, Blandine vend des sachets de pur water, des cartes de recharges téléphoniques et d’autres produits à son domicile. Blandine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. C’est la deuxième fois que  Blandine et les autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
NONVIGNON is a group made up of three women who live in the same neighborhood.  

Blandine (raising her hand in the photo) is the group's representative.  She is 39 years old and married to a man named Maximin.  The couple has five children, some of whom attend school.  Only three of their children are still their dependents.  Blandine lives with her husband and children.  The couple jointly takes care of the household expenses.  

Blandine has been selling sachets of PUR (water purifier powder), rechargeable phone cards and other items, from her home, for the past seventeen years.  She stocks up at a market in Benin.  

This is the second time that Blandine and the other members of the NONVIGNON group are requesting financial support from ALIDé in order to boost their working capital and their activities, and to better meet their customers' demand.  Their first loan was well repaid.

loans.use: to buy sachets of PUR (water purifier powder), rechargeable phone cards etc...

loans.name: Ayidote Group

texts.fr: AYIDOTE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vendent dans la même zone. La représentante du groupe, Noudégodo Honorine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 43 ans et est mariée à un certain Eugène. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Noudégodo Honorine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Noudégodo Honorine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de huit ans, Noudégodo Honorine vend des divers et des pommes fruits dans une ville du Benin. Noudégodo Honorine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. C’est la deuxième fois que Noudégodo Honorine et les autres membres du groupe AYIDOTE  sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le premier crédit reçu a été bien  remboursé.
texts.en:
Ayidote is a group of three people, who all sell in the same area. The group's representative, Noudégodo Honorine (hand raised in the photo), is 43 years old and is married to a man named Eugène. The couple has five children, all of whom go to school and are in their care. Noudégodo Honorine did not go to school. 

Noudégodo Honorine lives with her husband and children. She and her husband are both responsible for meeting the household's various expenses.  For nearly eight years,  Noudégodo Honorine has been selling miscellaneous items and apples in a town in Benin. She obtains her supplies from a market in Benin. This is the second time that Noudégodo Honorine and the other members of Ayidote have asked for fiancial support from ALIDé in order to increase their working capital and better meet customer demand. The first loan was fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy apples and miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Alejandro Rafael

texts.es: Alejandro de 30 años vive con su esposa y sus dos hijas en las edades de 5 y 8 años;  tienen una frutera, la cual inició cuando se le ocurrió vender mangos y ciruelas frente a un colegió, donde su mayor mercado eran los niños cuando salian del colegio al terminar s jornada educativa. Como en las vacaciones de los muchachos no tenia clientela, decidió irse a vender por la calle y fue así como le propuso la administradora de una empresa que se quedara a vender variedades de frutas en la puerta de la transportadora que ella dirigía, anotándole que debía mantener  un buen surtido, que respondiera a las necesidades del viajero. Y así fue como empezó  en este lugar y hoy lleva 6 años de estar ahí. Como cada le va mucho mejor, se siente satisfecho, pero su plan  de crecimiento es mayor que su capital de trabajo, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que haca a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará frutas en mayor volumen, para tener un diverso surtido en un punto en su casa donde atenderá su esposa, también mejorará el carro de frutas y comprar uniformes para mostrar su pulcritud en el manejo de los alimentos, acompañada de una excelente imagen comercial y esto es justamente lo que justifica el éxito de su inversión.
texts.en:
Alejandro, aged 30, lives with his wife and two daughters aged 5 and 8.  They have a fruit stand, which he started when he began selling mangoes and plums in front of a school.  His biggest market were the children who came out of the school at the end of the school day.

As he didn't have many customers during the kids' holidays, he decided to go sell on the street.  This was how he proposed to the administrator of a business that he sell a variety of fruit in the transportation center that she managed.  He noted to her that he would maintain a good stock which would meet the needs of the passengers.  It was in this way that he started at this location, and today he has been here for six years.

As things continue to go much better for him, he feels satisfied.  However, his plan for growth is greater than his working capital, which is the reason why he's come for a Kiva loan.  This his first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will purchase a greater volume of fruit so as to have a diverse stock at the fruit stand that his wife tends to at their home.  He will also improve his fruit cart, and purchase uniforms to show his hygienic food handling together with an excellent business image.  This is precisely what will justify the success of his investment.

loans.use: to purchase a greater volume of fruit, to improve his fruit cart, and to purchase uniforms.

loans.name: Angel Domingo

texts.es:
Angel Domingo tiene 47 años de edad es casado tiene 5 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en Guaranda Provincia de bolívar.
La VRC Emmanuel está conformada por 12 socios esta ventanilla queda a 40 minutos de la oficina ubicada en el recinto San Juan de Llullundongo perteneciente a Guaranda.
Angel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas, maíz, además cría pollos, cerdos.
Solicita el crédito para comprar animales y abonos, fertilizantes, urea, líquidos mata plagas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá incrementar la producción.
Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda semanalmente.
El sueño es poder tener un vehículo y una casa. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es el transporte y la competencia.
 En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar  y disfrutar de las fechas del carnaval.
 
ANGEL "ESTÀ MUY AGRADECIDO POR LA AYUDA BRINDADA EN EL CREDITO ANTERIOR Y LA CONFIANZA QUE HAN DEPOSITADO EN ESTA VENTANILLA PORQUE LES HA SERVIDO MUCHO PARA TRABAJAR EN LA AGRICULTURA".
texts.en:
Angel Domingo is 47 years old and married with 5 children. He lives with his wife and children in Guaranda province of Bolívar. 

The communal bank group 'Emmanuel' is made up of 12 members. It is 40 minutes away from the office, which is located in the precinct of San Juan de Llullundongo which is a part of Guaranda. 

Angel is a farmer who has crops of potatoes and corn, and he also raises chickens and pigs. He has requested this loan to buy animals, compost, fertilizers, urea and liquid pesticide. With the help of this loan he will be able to increase his production.  

He makes his purchases and sales in Guaranda on a weekly basis. His dream is to be able to have a car and a house. The challenges that he faces are transportation and competition. In his free time he likes to relax and enjoy the celebrations of Carnival.   

Angel is very happy for the help that the previous loan has provided him. He has trust in the communal bank because it has helped him greatly in his work in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy animals, compost, fertilizers, urea and liquid pesticide.

loans.name: Los Puntuales Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento LOS PUNTUALES  esta compuesto por  nueve integrantes, Siete mujeres y dos varones, la presidenta es la Sra. Mónica tiene 30 años y es soltera con 4 hijos, se dedica a la venta de comida su puesto de venta se encuentra en la zona 23 de diciembre, este es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Mónica utilizara este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción para un tinglado de su tienda ya que esta época de lluvias no le permite realizar un buen trabajo, y ya con el techo le protegerá de la lluvia e incluso del sol,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es Hacer crecer el negocio. La Sra. Mónica enfrenta retos en su negocio que son  La competencia del mercado y utilizara los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: The communal bank 'Los Puntuales' is made up of 9 members, 7 women and 2 men. The president is Mónica; she is 30 years old and a single mother of four children. She makes a living selling food. Her food stall is located in zone 23 of Diciembre. This is the second loan she has taken out. She will use it to buy construction material to put a roof over her food stall. It is currently rainy season, and it is difficult to work without covering. With a roof she will be protected from rain as well as sun. Her reason for taking out this loan is to grow her business. The challenge that Mónica faces is competition in the market. She wants to use the benefits she receives from her business to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to put a roof over her food stall.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: El Sr. Roberto tiene 28 años, no es casado pero convive con su pareja con la cual tienen dos  hijos que son de las edades de 2 y 4 anos. Su actividad es  Agricultura, el siembra papa, yuca, tiene su parcela en la localidad de el Porvenir. Este préstamo es la cuarta secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr.  Roberto utilizara este préstamo para la compra de semillas para la siembra de papa, Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir con la siembra para generar mas utilidades, el Sr. Roberto enfrenta retos en su negocio que son Poder sembrar y cosechar en mayor cantidad y  va a utilizar los beneficios Para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. La sueña por su negocio es Crecer en patrimonio para el bien de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Roberto is 28 years old. He is not married but lives with his partner, with whom he has 2 children who are 2 and 4 years old. He makes a living through agriculture by planting potatoes and yucca. He has a piece of land in the town of Porvenir. 

This loan is the fourth loan cycle of the institution. Roberto will use this loan to buy seeds and plant potatoes. He is asking for the loan so he can continue planting and generate more profit. Roberto faces challenges in his business such as being able to plant and harvest in large quantities. He is going to use the profits to improve his family's quality of life. His dream for his business is to increase his wealth for his children's wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy seeds and plant potatoes

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a food vendor from Tagbilaran, Bohol. She is 44 years old, married with 6 children aged between 8 and 23 years old. 

Eva started her business a year ago. She sells chorizo, hot dogs, and lumpia (spring rolls) to her community. She also makes meatballs to sell. Eva works hard to help send her children to school. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy more chorizo, hot dogs. and lumpia to sell. This loan will help increase Eva's profitability.

loans.use: to buy more chorizo, hot dogs, and lumpia to sell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros has been in the business of raising pigs for 5 years. She is a 46-year-old married woman with 5 children aged between 9 and 21. Milagros does her best to manage her time doing her hog-raising business and taking care of her children. She said she makes sure her family is able to eat three times a day.

Milagros has requested this loan to purchase piglets, vitamins and feeds. Any extra income she earns will go to her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, vitamins, and feeds
